Terminal.  The propylene oxide distribution system at the Lyondell North Charleston Distribution Terminal is managed/operated/maintained by DOW under contractual agreement with Lyondell.  There are no Lyondell or Covestro employees located at the North Charleston Distribution Terminal.  Covestro management at the South Charleston Plant provide instruction and direction to the DOW employees/contractors who operate the Lyondell North Charleston Distribution Terminal because a majority of the PO is owned by Covestro and is ultimately transferred into the Covestro PO distribution system at the South Charleston manufacturing facility for use by Covestro and DOW Chemical in their manufacturing units.  The PO that is not owned by Covestro is owned by Lyondell. The North Charleston Distribution Terminal facility is treated as a separate stationary source because the Kanawha River separates it from the South Charleston Manufacturing Plant; therefore, it is considered noncontiguous with the South Charleston Plant.  Lyondell ships propylene oxide from the Texas Gulf Coast by barge to the North Charleston Distribution Terminal for storage and subsequent transfer to the South Charleston Plant where it is used in Polyol manufacture by Covestro and as a raw material by DOW in several of its manufacturing units. 

In summary the Covestro South Charleston facility has one (1) RMP listed toxic chemical (propylene oxide) and no RMP flammable chemicals.  Propylene oxide was modeled using worst case release parameters as a screening exercise to determine the distance to toxic endpoint.    

c.  Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

The Lyondell North Charleston Distribution Terminal complies with all elements of the OSHA PSM Rule and the EPA RMP Rule.  There are safety procedures, standard operation emergency procedures, accident investigations, hot work and line opening permits, extensive training programs, on-site emergency response teams,

RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Covestro LLC
LYONDELL NORTH CHARLESTON DISTRIBUTION TERMINAL

Update May 16, 2019

a.  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Covestro LLC is committed to the principles of Responsible Care which emphasize operating in a safe and environmentally correct manner. Management systems are in place to assure all facilities are complying with these principles.  There are Corporate Engineering Standards and Health, Environment and Safety Guidelines which address every aspect of Risk Management from design of intrinsically safe processes, to the use of risk assessment, to incident tracking and program audits. Covestro is headquartered in Leverkusen, Germany. The US (country) headquarters for Covestro is located in Pittsburgh, PA.  Covestro LLC was formerly a division of Bayer AG.  Covestro has established guidelines for Responsible Care in Environmental Protection and Safety, which include a Directive for Process and Plant Safety that all Covestro facilities world-wide are expected to follow.  It provides guidance for safe process design and operation.
In the US, Covestro LLC is an active member of the American Chemistry Council's Responsible Care Initiative.  Covestro has implemented all seven codes (Pollution Prevention, Distribution, Product Stewardship, Employee health & Safety, Security: and Community Awareness & Emergency Response) of management practice.  Covestro LLC has a Health, Safety, Environment, Energy and Quality Policy which states that it is the company's responsibility to protect the environment and the health and safety of its employees, customers and communities.  This is a primary responsibility, of equal importance to any other business objective.  This is supported in the Covestro LLC Visions, Values and Beliefs, which emphases applying technical expertise to advance our business while assuring the safety and protection of our employees, customers, communities and the environment.

The Lyondell Chemical Company North Charleston Distribution Terminal is a tenant facility within the DOW Chemical Company North Charleston Distribution Terminal.  Lyondell owns the propylene oxide (PO) equipment that is subject to RMP, but Covestro owns the majority of the PO stored in the Lyondell equipment. Lyondell has a contract with Union Carbide Corporation, a subsidiary of the DOW Chemical Company (DOW), to operate and maintain the PO equipment as well as provide emergency response services. 

The Lyondell North Charleston Distribution Terminal is committed to operating and maintaining all of the processes in a safe and responsible manner.  A combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning programs has been implemented to help ensure the safety of workers and the public, as well as to protect the environment.  These programs include Lyondell's Manufacturing Excellence requirements, DOW's Operating Discipline Management System requirements, and governmental requirements, such as the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Risk Management Program (RMP) rule (40 CFR Part 68) and the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119).  

In addition, the Lyondell North Charleston Distribution Terminal uses the following measures to assure the safety of our chemical processes:

ENGINEERING and DESIGN

* Detailed operating procedures
* Special safety standards (Operational Safety Standards or OSS)
* Special equipment standards
* Special piping and valves
* Remotely operated isolation valves
* State of the art computerized controls
* Redundant & energy protected controls
* Dual independent high level alarms
* Automatic shut down of filling operations on receipt of high level alarm 
* Continuous improvement of processes & equipment
* Management of Change procedures
* Color coding and labeling of piping & vessels
* Dikes and curbs to contain spills

* Production units designed to withstand natural disasters
* Control Room protection during emergencies

DETECTION

* Portable monitors for leak detection
* Surveillance cameras

TRAINING

* Refresher and safety training for all employees
* New employee qualification requirements
* Emergency response drills
* Specialized maintenance skills training
* Worker certification programs
* Off-site specialized training for emergency response teams

INSPECTIONS and SAFETY REVIEWS

* Incident investigations and reviews
* Systematic equipment inspection
* Critical instrument and pressure relief valve inspections
* Reactive chemicals/Process Hazard Analyses every 5 years
* Extensive fugitive emissions monitoring program
* Regular safety audits of all operating units
* Tracking system for recommendations

MEDICAL MANAGEMENT

* Certified Emergency Management Technician's on each shift
* Medical procedures coordinated with local hospitals
* Medical service is provided by DOW 

MITIGATION

* Release containment equipment and materials
* Release containment procedures
* Extensive area water sprinkler system
* Foam vapor suppression capability

EMERGENCY RESPONSE

* Trained emergency response teams
* Written emergency action plans
* Emergency teams maintained on all shifts in the South Charleston manufacturing facility
* Emergency alarm systems for units, plant, and community*
* Coordination with Kanawha Putnam LEPC, Charleston Fire Department and other Local Agencies

EMPLOYEE PARTICIPATION

* Periodic review of operating procedures
* Employees participate on incident investigation team
* Employees (hourly and salaried) participate on multiple safety committees

b.  Facility Description and Regulated Substances Handled

The Lyondell North Charleston Distribution Terminal is a storage and redistribution facility for chemicals manufactured at other locations, and is a tenant facility within the DOW North Charleston Distribution

vessel inspection programs, and experienced personnel both in the salaried and hourly workforce.  

d.  Five Year Accident History

There have been no releases in the past five years with off-site consequences

e.  Facility Emergency Response Program

The Lyondell North Charleston Distribution Terminal consists of volunteer emergency response teams from DOW that work rotating shifts and straight days.  The goal is to have 3 - 6 emergency squad members always available on shift and this group is supplemented by straight day people, call outs and the Charleston Fire Department.  The DOW emergency squad people receive approximately 16 to 24 hours of on-site training annually with some disciplines receiving off-site training as well in specialized subjects, such as fire fighting, rescue, incident command and Hazmat.  In the case of a significant fire the Charleston Fire department would be involved.  The plant also participates in local fire and industrial mutual aid systems through the Kanawha Putnam Emergency Planning Committee (KPEPC). Community warning sirens are placed in multiple places in the Kanawha Valley and there is one within 1 mile of the plant. 

The Lyondell North Charleston Distribution Terminal maintains a written emergency response program to protect worker and public safety, as well as the environment.  The program consists of procedures for responding to releases of hazardous substances, including the possibility of a fire or explosion if a flammable substance is accidentally released.  The procedures address all aspects of emergency response including:

*	Proper first-aid and medical treatment for exposures 
*	Evacuation plans and accounting for personnel after an evacuation
*	Notification of local emergency response agencies and the public if a release occurs
*	Post-incident cleanup and decontamination requirements, and
*	Inspecting, testing, maintaining, and using emergency response equipment.

The emergency response program is

updated when necessary based on modifications made to facility processes.

f.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety

No changes are currently planned.
